intro: Connarus pachyneurus, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a small, deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded habitats. The plant has traditional medicinal uses in some African communities.
